answer: Hello! I’m the Internship Assistant FAQ Bot. I’m here to help you with all your questions related to the internship program, including tasks, submission, certificates, and more. How can I assist you today?

This internship program is designed to provide students with hands-on, real-world experience through practical tasks and projects. The main objective is to help interns develop industry-relevant skills, improve problem-solving abilities, and strengthen their resume.

This internship is open to students from various educational backgrounds, including beginners. Prior experience is not mandatory, and anyone interested in learning and gaining practical experience is encouraged to apply.
The internship is conducted in online mode, allowing interns to work remotely. The duration is typically around one month, depending on the assigned tasks and the program schedule.

Interns are assigned practical and beginner-friendly tasks related to their chosen domain. Usually, a minimum of two or three tasks must be completed. The workload is manageable and designed to support learning and skill development.

Interns must upload their completed projects to a GitHub repository and submit the repository link through the official submission form before the deadline. Late submissions are subject to approval based on internship guidelines.

Submitted projects are reviewed by the evaluation team based on correctness, completeness, and adherence to the given instructions. Feedback or results are shared after the evaluation process is completed.
Interns who successfully complete and submit the required tasks receive a verified completion certificate. A Letter of Recommendation may also be provided based on performance and quality of work.

This internship primarily focuses on learning and skill development. Stipend details depend on the specific program, but the internship offers valuable experience, certification, and resume enhancement.

Interns may be required to share their internship experience or project updates on LinkedIn. A short project explanation or demo video may also be required, explaining the project idea, implementation, and functionality.
For any technical issues or general queries, interns can reach out to the support team through the official communication channels provided during the internship.
While a job is not guaranteed, high-performing interns may receive placement support or future opportunities based on their performance and project quality.
Interns are expected to follow the program guidelines. Each intern may receive a unique internship ID, and the internship is recognized as a learning-based program focused on skill development.
